gpio.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 // GPIO.cpp is based on Guillermo A. Amaral's blink.c example as
2 // featured in p1load
3 
4 /* blink.c
5 *
6 * Raspberry Pi GPIO example using sysfs interface.
7 * Guillermo A. Amaral B. <g@maral.me>
8 */
9 
10 #include "gpio.h"
11 
12 extern "C"
13 {
14 #include <sys/stat.h>
15 #include <sys/types.h>
16 #include <fcntl.h>
17 #include <stdio.h>
18 #include <stdlib.h>
19 #include <unistd.h>
20 }
21 
22 #define BUFFER_MAX 3
23 
24 GPIO::GPIO(int pin, int dir)
25 {
26  this->pin = pin;
27  this->dir = dir;
28  GPIO::Export(pin);
29  GPIO::Direction(pin, dir);
30 }
31 
32 GPIO::~GPIO()
33 {
34  GPIO::Unexport(pin);
35 }
36 
37 int GPIO::Read()
38 {
39  return GPIO::Read(pin);
40 }
41 
42 int GPIO::Write(int value)
43 {
44  return GPIO::Write(pin, value);
45 }
46 
47 int GPIO::Export(int pin)
48 {
49  char buffer[BUFFER_MAX];
50  ssize_t bytes_written;
51  int fd;
52 
53  fd = open("/sys/class/gpio/export", O_WRONLY);
54  if (-1 == fd) {
55  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open export for writing!\n");
56  return(-1);
57  }
58 
59  bytes_written = snprintf(buffer, BUFFER_MAX, "%d", pin);
60  if (1 != write(fd, buffer, bytes_written))
61  {
62  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write value!\n");
63  return(-1);
64  }
65  close(fd);
66  return(0);
67 }
68 
69 int GPIO::Unexport(int pin)
70 {
71  char buffer[BUFFER_MAX];
72  ssize_t bytes_written;
73  int fd;
74 
75  fd = open("/sys/class/gpio/unexport", O_WRONLY);
76  if (-1 == fd) {
77  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open unexport for writing!\n");
78  return(-1);
79  }
80 
81  bytes_written = snprintf(buffer, BUFFER_MAX, "%d", pin);
82  if (1 != write(fd, buffer, bytes_written))
83  {
84  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write value!\n");
85  return(-1);
86  }
87  close(fd);
88  return(0);
89 }
90 
91 int GPIO::Direction(int pin, int dir)
92 {
93  static const char s_directions_str[] = "in\0out";
94 
95 #define DIRECTION_MAX 35
96  char path[DIRECTION_MAX];
97  int fd;
98 
99  snprintf(path, DIRECTION_MAX, "/sys/class/gpio/gpio%d/direction", pin);
100  fd = open(path, O_WRONLY);
101  if (-1 == fd) {
102  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open gpio direction for writing!\n");
103  return(-1);
104  }
105 
106  if (-1 == write(fd, &s_directions_str[GPIO::In == dir ? 0 : 3], GPIO::In == dir ? 2 : 3)) {
107  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to set direction!\n");
108  return(-1);
109  }
110 
111  close(fd);
112  return(0);
113 }
114 
115 int GPIO::Read(int pin)
116 {
117 #define VALUE_MAX 30
118  char path[VALUE_MAX];
119  char value_str[3];
120  int fd;
121 
122  snprintf(path, VALUE_MAX, "/sys/class/gpio/gpio%d/value", pin);
123  fd = open(path, O_RDONLY);
124  if (-1 == fd) {
125  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open gpio value for reading!\n");
126  return(-1);
127  }
128 
129  if (-1 == read(fd, value_str, 3)) {
130  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to read value!\n");
131  return(-1);
132  }
133 
134  close(fd);
135 
136  return(atoi(value_str));
137 }
138 
139 int GPIO::Write(int pin, int value)
140 {
141  static const char s_values_str[] = "01";
142 
143  char path[VALUE_MAX];
144  int fd;
145 
146  snprintf(path, VALUE_MAX, "/sys/class/gpio/gpio%d/value", pin);
147  fd = open(path, O_WRONLY);
148  if (-1 == fd) {
149  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open gpio value for writing!\n");
150  return(-1);
151  }
152 
153  if (1 != write(fd, &s_values_str[GPIO::Low == value ? 0 : 1], 1)) {
154  fprintf(stderr, "Failed to write value!\n");
155  return(-1);
156  }
157 
158  close(fd);
159  return(0);
160 }
